description: Erection of a mixed use development comprising of a part two and three storey building for a Social, Emotional & Mental Health school for 90 pupils and three blocks ranging from three to five storeys in height comprising of 124 residential units with associated works, access, landscaping, refuse stores, car and cycle parking.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The proposed development has failed to demonstrate that it complies with the Agent of Change principle and fails to demonstrate that it has been suitably designed to ensure that established noise and other nuisance-generating uses remain viable and can continue or grow without unreasonable restrictions being placed on them. The submitted Noise Impact Assessment and subsequent Technical Notes fails to fully understand and mitigate any possible noise impacts from the neighbouring Gurdwara Sri Guru Singh Sabha Sikh Temple on the proposed development. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Local Plan (2015) policies SC5 (Ensuring suitable internal and external space) and CC2 (Urban design and architecture), London Plan (2021) policies D13 (Agent of Change) and D14 (Noise) and Paragraph 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
Condition : 2 - The proposed development, by reason of its proximity to the boundaries of the site and the positioning, number and design of windows and balconies, would be an intrusive and unneighbourly addition resulting in a loss of privacy, by way of actual and perceived overlooking, enjoyed by occupants of neighbouring properties within Perkin Close as well as the users of the neighbouring Gurdwara Sri Guru Singh Sabha Sikh Temple. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Local Plan (2015) policies SC4 (Scale and density of new housing development) and CC2 (Urban design and architecture) and Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
Condition : 3 - The proposed development, by reason of its design and quantum, fails to provide sufficient external amenity and play space, in terms of quantum and quality, for the future occupants harmful to their living conditions. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Local Plan (2015) policies SC5 (Ensuring suitable internal and external space), CC2 (Urban design and architecture) and GB9 (Play space, outdoor sports facilities and burial space), London Plan (2021) policies D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach), D6 (Housing quality and standards) and S4 (Play and informal recreation) and Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
Condition : 4 - The proposed development would, in the absence of a completed legal agreement to secure necessary planning obligations, fail to secure affordable housing, fail to secure a Community Use Agreement, fail to secure healthcare financial contributions, fail to provide construction and employment training, fail to restrict future occupants of the proposed development from obtaining parking permits, fail to secure necessary highway works and fail to secure the provision of comprehensive travel plans for the development, thereby failing to assist in limiting the use of the private car and contributing to the use of more sustainable modes of transport, fail to secure a carbon neutral development, fail to secure a connection to a future District Heat Network, fail to submit a Considerate Contractors Scheme, and fail to provide appropriate marketing to future occupants of the neighbouring Gurdwara Sri Guru Singh Sabha Sikh Temple. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Local Plan (2015) policy IMP3 and London Plan (2021) policy DF1, coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
